intro: Hieracium pseudocaesiiforme, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
